Reviews.Title: Very good for normal photos
Reviews.Author: Roland Edwards
Reviews.Content: The camera works very well, especially for normal photos, but very close up photos are a little blurry when you zoom way in. They still look great at normal view. It also takes good video but it's not HD quality. You can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Vivatar Camera
Reviews.Author: memryymakr
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our 6 year old granddaughter as a Christmas gift. Was disappointed that anSD card and batteries were not included. Camera took OK pictures. I guess you get what you pay for..

Reviews.Title: Belongs in a Five Dollar Store
Reviews.Author: Steve the Pirate
Reviews.Content: Purchased name brand batteries, they were drained after an hour of video and about 20 pictures.Screen options do not allow you to hide all the distracting details about iso, flash settings, and picture quality.Wrist band is mounted on the top corner instead of the bottom.  The camera always feels upside down because of this.Twenty dollars was too much for this child's toy.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF WHAT AMAZON SHOWS YOU IN THEIR ADS.
Reviews.Author: Bill Pelley
Reviews.Content: The camera takes pretty good pictures but requires new batteries every day/  I don't know if I can afford to feed it.  You also didn't tell me it needed a memory card.  I would have bought one from you if you had told me.Headline BEWARE OF WHAT AMAZON SHOWS YOU.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Grant Miller
Reviews.Content: This is a great starter camera for a child or a low budget / resolution one for when images don't need to be too crisp.  Pictures look better taken at medium rather than short range.  The advertised "anti-shake" technology sometimes fails to live up to its promise, so I've learned to take several shots whenever possible in order to pick the best later.  Otherwise it met or exceeded all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera to use for what I need it for.  Easy to carry and pictures are pretty good for an inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Donna V. "Donna V."
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 5-year-old son, who loves to take things apart. This must be a fairly durable because it's still in one piece, after several weeks of him using it. It also takes very clear pictures. I would highly recommend this camera if you are looking for something inexpensive that takes good pics. Also, since it comes with a small amount of memory on the camera itself, we were able to not use the memory card we bought for it, which he kept taking out and putting in backwards. The much cheaper quality Vivitar I had ordered before this one and returned required you to use a memory card. So, my son has fun with it taking pictures with the memory on the camera itself. It's really a great little camera for a young child. It's way cheaper than the "toy" ones I was looking at, and I'd prefer him having a real camera anyway.

Reviews.Title: Vivitar Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: C. A. Isbell "bassistann57"
Reviews.Content: This thing cost 1/12th of what my Sony camera cost, and it is A LOT BETTER!  It's easier to use, more lightweight, it just rocks all the way around!

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Judith D. Hayes
Reviews.Content: We were going out of the country and I purchased it for my grand-daughter.  Every time I saw her, that camera was in her hands.

ProductInfo.Features:
PicBridge ready with SD card support
4x Digital zoom with antishake feature
Can also be used to take video clips
Red eye reduction and face and smile detection capability
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar Digital Still Camera (V7024-KIWI)
